name: Ugh!
summary:
Ugh! is an arcade/flight game developed by Bones Park Software Artistic and published in 1992 by PlayByte for the Amiga, Commodore 64 and DOS.

The game is a clone of Space Taxi. It features a caveman who, in order to appeal to his beloved future mate, controls a stone-age muscle-powered helicopter, picking up passengers and flying them to the desired location for money. The player must venture through 69 levels, and must evade natural obstacles as well as hostile Dinosaurs and "Birds" (actually pterosaurs). Collisions with obstacles, hard landings and touching obstacles with the helicopter's rotor inflict damage to the helicopter. Also, powering the helicopter exhausts the pilot, which may be recovered by picking up fruits knocked off Tree with Stone. Stone may be also dropped on a hostile monster, knocking it out for a short time.

Ugh! was later distributed as a shareware mainly from Bulletin Board Systems and magazine cover disks.

The Commodore 64 version of the game also features a two player hotseat mode, in which two players compete to finish the level, while the DOS and Amiga versions feature a cooperative simultaneous two player mode.

The game keeps tracks of the player's progress using level codes; the codes for single player levels are Christian Death song titles, the two-player codes are song titles by Current 93.

name: Ugly Americans: Apocalypsegeddon
summary: With four-player top-down co-op gameplay that hearkens back to such classics as Gauntlet and Robotron, "Ugly Americans: Apocalypsegeddon" features four playable characters, each with their own unique abilities, weapons and strengths. Players must comb the streets of New York City and pacify raving demons, delinquent man birds and zombies by lactating fire or hurling wacky objects like flying demon skulls, fish, baseballs and wrenches.

name: Ugoku E Ver. 2.0: Aryol
summary: Ugoku E Ver. 2.0: Aryol is a Puzzle game with a Russian motif, published by Altron, which was released in Japan in 1994.

name: Ugly Dot
summary: Ugly Dot is a Moble/PC Platformer about raging and challenge.

name: Ugetsu Kitan
summary: A Visual Novel based on Ugetsu Monogatari, a collection of nine supernatural tales by the Japanese author Ueda Akinari.

name: Ugh!
summary: A single-screen collec'em up written by Chris Morris and published by Softek for several 8-bit homecomputers.

name: UglyDolls
summary: Robots are cool when they're blinking lights and zooming by with their sleek metallic finish. In UglyDolls: An Imperfect Adventure, a whole horde of robots are on the loose and taking over Uglyville trying to make it 'perfect!'.

name: Uggies Garden
summary: Is a two player split screen maze game where player one takes control of the top character and player two of the bottom.

name: Ugly
summary: Ugly is a psycho-dark fairy tale with new mechanics. You will have to swap the main character with his own reflection to solve puzzles, defeat bosses and discover all the secrets in a palace where nothing is what it seems.

name: Ugby Mumba 3
summary: Run and gun with Mumba on his quest to rescue his girlfriend and his eggs from the clutches of evil!

name: Ug! Caveman Game
summary:
A caveman game you control with your voice.

If a caveman is near and you call out "UG!, UG!, UG!" they will follow you! Lead your fellow cavemen to safety, avoid hazards and dangers.

name: Ugo Volt
summary:
Ugo Volt was an action-adventure shooter set in a post-apocalyptic Lisbon in the 22nd century, the world would be at a detriment due to global warming and only Ugo would be able to define the destiny of humanity.
It started development in 1999 as an entry to a contest from Infogrames Portugal with the title of Fusion, placing it at 7th place. It eventually was renamed Doshowbikum: The Run when Move Interactive was formed and renamed again when the game was further in development to simply as Ugo Volt, being showcased at E3 2006.

In 2007, the game was put on hold due to financial difficulties after its fundraisers pulled out of the project, and by 2008, the company was out of business.

name: Ugly Button Adventure
summary: The Ugly Button Adventure is a classic example of point and click and escape room adventure games that are loved by many gamers around the world. Players will have to solve puzzles and interact with different objects in the game to progress and escape from the unknown room. If you are a fan of escape room games, then Ugly Button Adventure will be right up your alley. It has all the elements that make escape rooms so thrilling, such as hidden clues, puzzles, and a sense of urgency to escape.

name: Ugaris: The Legend Recovered
summary: Welcome, Adventurer, to the enigmatic realms of Astonia. A world brimming with danger and opportunity awaits. Arm yourself with valor and let your powers craft your destiny.

name: Ugomeku Note
summary: Welcome to the world of UGOMEKU NOTE (“Wriggling Note”). You—gentle, kind, and always wearing a lovely smile—have been chosen as a hero to embark on an adventure full of humor and heart. This is a handcrafted RPG made with RPG Maker MV. All graphics, music, and systems are being created by a solo developer.

name: Ugmania
summary: A sandbox survival game set in a universe full of procedurally generated worlds to explore and conquer!

name: UG
summary:
Raise Dino

Hatch egg. Cute and small. Name dino, maybe GRUG, maybe dumb name. Dino spin, follow, roll over. Feed dino. Chicken? Pig? Friend? Dino big now. Ride dino. You control.

Fight Big Boss

Climb volcano. Explore cave. Big treasure! Maybe danger? No scared. Brave! Fight with friend. Push friend off cliff. Laugh?

Play with Friend

No dino? Ride on friend dino! Want fight friend? Bring weapon. Want fight all friends? Bring big weapon.

Wear New Loincloth

Old loincloth ugly. New loincloth pretty. UG sexy now? Find other new clothes, change how UG look.
